result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Hipke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other probation or in custody sentence defendant is currently serving

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: Eligible for huber for work, treatment, childcare, or schooling. Eligible for EMP.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other probation or in custody sentence defendant is currently serving

Current: 153 S Meadow Lane, Lyndon Station, WI 53944 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2016)

to Judge Jacobson from J.J.H.
Request/Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation as Alternative to Revocation of Probation
Granting Good Time Credits
On Custody Credits: Proposed Order
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:25 pm 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 4 (Felony BJ/ Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 7 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
          : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Abernethy-Mays makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2.5 years probation - CONDITION On Ct. 1 ONLY: 9 months MCJ with huber for work/treatment/child care/schooling or EMP if eligible on. 
                                                                              - CONDITIONS On ALL: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of CS per week; absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT ORDERS sentence concurrent to any other probation or in custody sentence deft is currently serving. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 190 days jail credit. 

Adj: 1:43 pm
ad Prosequendum

Case Called: 2:34 pm 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays. 
COURT notes review of defense's motion for bond modification. 
Atty Abernethy-Mays makes statement regarding possible treatment opportunity. 
State objects to bond modification. 
Argument. 
COURT questions Atty Abernethy-Mays regarding cases in other counties and deft's county of residency. 
Atty Abernethy-Mays notes deft is on probation in Outagamie County. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT modifies bond to $2,000 cash and $18,000 signature with same conditions. 
COURT has no objection to deft serving conditional time in Outagamie County and cash bond in this case being subordinate to that conditional time. 
COURT indicates if deft is accepted into some type of inpatient treatment it would reconsider cash condition of bond. 
PTC set for 6/12/2015. 
Atty Abernethy-Mays requests deft be returned to Outagamie County. 
COURT questions jail court officer regarding deft's custody status. 
COURT directs Atty Abernethy-Mays to investigate matter. 
Atty Abernethy-Mays notes deft was returned to Marathon County due to cash bond. 
COURT modifies $2000 cash bail requirement that it only take effect if the deft is NOT serving conditional jail time in another county.
